definition[0]: to no longer do an activity or belong to a group
example[0]: The group gets smaller as members move away or drop out.
definition[1]: to leave a school or university before your course has finished
example[1]: Bill dropped out of college after his first year.
definition[2]: to refuse to take part in ordinary society because you do not agree with its principles
example[2]: In the 60s, Leary urged kids to ‘Turn on, tune in and drop out.’
definition[3]: if an Internet connection drops out, it suddenly stops, usually for a short time
